jd.notes_for_resume:
- Emphasize 5+ years of ML engineering with end-to-end product delivery from data to production.
- List languages (Python, Java, C++, Go) and frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Spark) prominently in skills and project sections.
- Detail ML infrastructure you built: feature/data pipelines, training workflows, CI/CD for ML, deployment, and monitoring/alerting.
- Showcase real-time and batch inference systems with concrete latency, throughput, and uptime metrics.
- Highlight zero-to-one ML initiatives and leadership of small cross-functional efforts delivering new customer-facing features.
- Include examples of partnering with scientists, full-stack, and firmware teams; note your role bridging research and production.
- Quantify impact (e.g., reduced safety incidents, efficiency gains, cost savings) and scale (e.g., high-volume telemetry, millions of events/devices).
- Mention algorithmic expertise and how you selected/tuned models for business outcomes.
- Add any IoT/edge or computer vision work relevant to Samsara’s product pillars.
- Include BS/MS in Computer Science or related quantitative field.

profile.headline: SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
bullets: AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products, owning architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI capabilities.
Designed and deployed LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock with RAG and vector search to auto-generate fraud, provider risk, and patient risk narratives.
Built agentic AI workflows (LangGraph + Bedrock) for multi-step fraud pattern discovery, data retrieval, and explanation generation.
Engineered HIPAA-compliant ML pipelines on SageMaker and Glue (PySpark) processing 116M+ Medicaid claims annually with MLflow tracking and governed deployments.
Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay and post-pay FWA detection, provider risk scoring, and patient risk stratification.
Implemented monitoring for drift, bias, and performance using SageMaker Clarify and custom dashboards with defined SLOs and alerts.
Designed robust APIs and data contracts exposing scores, risk tiers, and GenAI explanations to downstream systems.
Mentored engineers and analysts on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experimentation; influenced AI roadmap and governance.
Medicaid Patient Risk Scoring: engineered features from claims, utilization, chronic conditions, demographics, and care gaps; deployed on SageMaker with Glue and Redshift/S3.
Medicaid Provider Risk Scoring: built provider risk engine aggregating claim, member, and peer-comparison features; integrated into Program Intelligence and SIU workflows.
Program Intelligence: combined supervised models, unsupervised pattern mining, network analysis, and LLM narratives to detect FWA.
AuditStudio (North Dakota): designed PCA and KMeans pipelines for post-pay audit prioritization with Glue PySpark ETL and Redshift/S3 delivery.
ClaimsSure: deployed pre-pay fraud scoring (logistic regression + rule-based logic) with scoring APIs, thresholds, and production monitoring.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant (Software Engineer)
bullets: Developed and enhanced modules for Medicaid encounter processing and Open Health Plus using Java, PL/SQL, and SQL.
Implemented backend services, stored procedures, and batch jobs to process high-volume healthcare claims and membership data.
Refactored legacy code into modular components, reducing defects and accelerating delivery of regulatory requirements.
Translated CMS/state regulations into technical designs, sequence diagrams, and data contracts.
Participated in code reviews, performance tuning, and deployment planning with onshore/offshore teams using Git/SVN and Jenkins.

experience.title: Programmer Analyst (Software Engineer)
bullets: Built and maintained backend components for FedEx eDD and related enterprise systems.
Developed REST/SOAP integrations, validation logic, and transformation pipelines for document and shipment workflows.
Created internal tools in Java/SQL and scripting to automate operational tasks, log analysis, and data reconciliation.
Analyzed production incidents, reproduced bugs, and delivered fixes with regression test coverage.
Followed engineering best practices including version control, branching strategies, peer reviews, and release checklists.

experience.title: Programmer (Software Engineer)
bullets: Contributed to core modules of the HealthPAS Medicaid system implementing business rules and batch processes.
Developed and optimized SQL/PL/SQL queries, procedures, and views for transactional workflows and reporting.
Built integration components to move data between claims processing, credentialing, and analytics systems.
Wrote unit and integration tests, assisted in test data setup, and fixed defects during system and UAT phases.
Collaborated with BA, QA, and infrastructure teams to debug environment-specific issues and improve stability.

education: Nizam College — B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics (Sep 2003 – May 2007), Hyderabad, India

certifications.name: Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions

Strong in model operations (drift/bias monitoring, SLOs/alerts), Python/Java, Spark, and frameworks including PyTorch and TensorFlow. Proven zero-to-one delivery and cross-functional leadership bridging research, engineering, and product.

tailored.resume_text:
NARENDER SURABHI
Senior Machine Learning Engineer | End-to-End ML & MLOps
Okemos, MI, USA 48864 | +1 (213) 254-8205 | surabhinarenderrao@gmail.com
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/narendersurabhi | GitHub: https://github.com/narendersurabhi

Summary
Senior Machine Learning Engineer with 8+ years leading end-to-end ML and GenAI solutions from data pipelines and training to serving and monitoring on AWS. Built HIPAA-compliant ML infrastructure and shipped batch and API-based inference at scale (116M+ Medicaid claims/year) using SageMaker, Glue (PySpark), and MLflow. Strong in model operations (drift/bias monitoring, SLOs/alerts), Python/Java, Spark, and frameworks including PyTorch and TensorFlow. Proven zero-to-one delivery and cross-functional leadership bridging research, engineering, and product.

Skills
- ML Engineering & MLOps: End-to-end ML application development; ML pipelines: training, feature stores, serving; Batch and API-based model serving; Production deployment & CI/CD for ML; Model monitoring: performance, drift & bias (SageMaker Clarify)
- Data Platforms & Cloud: AWS SageMaker, Glue (PySpark), Redshift, S3; AWS Lambda, Step Functions; MLflow experiment tracking; Docker, Kubernetes/EKS; Kafka
- Languages & Frameworks: Python, Java; Apache Spark (PySpark); PyTorch, TensorFlow/Keras, scikit-learn; XGBoost; SQL/PLSQL, REST APIs
- GenAI & Vector Search: AWS Bedrock; RAG, LangChain, LangGraph; Vector search: FAISS, Chroma; Agentic workflows, prompt engineering
- Algorithms & Techniques: Classification, regression; Anomaly detection; Clustering (KMeans), PCA; Feature engineering & evaluation

Experience
Acentra Health — Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
Okemos, MI | Dec 2016 – Present
- AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products; owned architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI capabilities end to end.
- Engineered HIPAA-compliant ML pipelines on AWS SageMaker and Glue (PySpark) processing 116M+ Medicaid claims annually with MLflow tracking and governed deployments.
- Delivered API-based pre-pay fraud scoring (logistic regression + rule-based logic) and batch post-pay audit prioritization, including thresholds, rollout, and production monitoring.
- Implemented model observability with SageMaker Clarify and custom dashboards for drift, bias, and performance; established SLOs and alerting.
- Designed and deployed LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock with RAG and vector search (FAISS/Chroma) to auto-generate provider and patient risk narratives integrated via APIs.
- Built agentic AI workflows (LangGraph + Bedrock) for multi-step fraud pattern discovery, data retrieval, and explanation generation.
- Developed risk scoring engines aggregating features from claims, utilization, chronic conditions, demographics, and care gaps; integrated outputs into Program Intelligence, SIU, and care-management workflows.
- Combined supervised models with PCA/KMeans pattern mining, network analysis, and LLM narratives to surface FWA leads within Program Intelligence.
- Mentored engineers/analysts on GenAI, MLOps, and Python best practices; influenced AI roadmap and governance and authored robust data contracts and scoring APIs.

Infosys Limited — Senior Associate Consultant (Software Engineer)
Los Angeles, CA & Pune, India | Sep 2013 – Dec 2015
- Developed and enhanced Medicaid encounter processing and Open Health Plus modules using Java, SQL, and PL/SQL, including high-volume batch jobs.
- Implemented backend services, stored procedures, data contracts, and batch pipelines; performed performance tuning and CI/CD with Jenkins and version control (Git/SVN).
- Translated CMS/state regulations into technical designs and sequence diagrams; participated in code reviews and deployment planning across onshore/offshore teams.

Syntel Limited — Programmer Analyst (Software Engineer)
Pune, India | Aug 2010 – Sep 2013
- Built and maintained backend components for FedEx eDD; developed REST/SOAP integrations, validation logic, and transformation pipelines for document and shipment workflows.
- Created internal tools in Java/SQL and scripting to automate operations, log analysis, and data reconciliation; analyzed production incidents and shipped fixes with regression tests.

Cognizant — Programmer (Software Engineer)
Hyderabad, India | Sep 2007 – Aug 2010
- Contributed to core modules of the HealthPAS Medicaid system with SQL/PLSQL-driven business rules, batch processing, and integration components across transactional and reporting workflows.

Education
- Nizam College — B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics (Sep 2003 – May 2007), Hyderabad, India

Certifications

- Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions, Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), 2022

issues.message: C++ experience is not present despite being listed as a must-have language in the JD.
Golang (Go) experience is not present despite being listed as a must-have language in the JD.
Real-time serving claim is not backed by concrete latency/throughput/uptime metrics, making the scope of 'real-time' ambiguous.
PyTorch/TensorFlow are listed but not tied to specific production models or workloads.
issues.location_hint: Skills > Languages & Frameworks; Experience > Acentra Health

issues.message: Feature store is mentioned without identifying the implementation (e.g., SageMaker Feature Store or custom), leaving infra depth unclear.
Apache Spark usage appears primarily via Glue (PySpark); no mention of streaming (e.g., Spark Streaming/Kafka) for continuous inference pipelines.
issues.location_hint: Skills > Data Platforms & Cloud; Experience > Acentra Health

issues.message: Java experience is demonstrated but mostly in earlier roles; no recent production microservice details are provided.

suggestions: If applicable, surface any C++ or Go experience (even small services, tooling, or contributions); otherwise note adjacent systems-level work and willingness to work in these languages.
Add concrete serving metrics: p50/p95 latency, QPS/throughput, uptime/SLOs, autoscaling behavior, and deployment frequency for real-time and batch systems.
Tie PyTorch/TensorFlow to specific production models (task, dataset size, training setup, hardware, optimization like quantization/distillation) to evidence practical use.
Specify the feature store implementation (e.g., SageMaker Feature Store or custom solution) and describe feature lineage, backfills, and point-in-time correctness guarantees.
Detail model deployment strategies (blue/green, canary, shadow) and CI/CD tooling used (Jenkins/GitHub Actions), plus rollback and versioning practices.
Describe monitoring/alerting stack end to end (CloudWatch/Prometheus/Datadog, alert routing/on-call), include concrete drift/performance thresholds and actioning.
Expand on streaming/real-time pipelines if used (Kafka topics/partitions, consumer groups, exactly-once/at-least-once semantics) and how they feed online inference.
Quantify business impact: dollars in fraud prevented, audit prioritization lift, investigation time reduced, cost savings from infra optimizations.
Add recent service implementation details (Java or Python/gRPC) for model serving: frameworks, containerization, orchestration (EKS), and API contracts.
If applicable, highlight any IoT/edge or computer vision work and collaboration with firmware/hardware teams to align with Samsara’s product domain.

cover_letter.body:
I’m a senior ML engineer with 8+ years building and operating production ML platforms and applications at scale. I’m drawn to Samsara’s real-time, high-availability challenges and believe my background in low-latency serving, streaming data, and MLOps would add immediate value.

I’ve owned end-to-end delivery from data ingestion and feature stores through training, deployment, and monitoring on AWS (SageMaker, EKS, Glue/Spark). I build both real-time and batch inference with CI/CD, model registry, blue/green and canary rollouts, and robust observability. I work primarily in Python and Java, with working knowledge of Go and C++ for performance-sensitive components, and practical experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Spark. I frequently bridge research and production and lead small cross-functional efforts to ship customer-facing ML features.

Recent impact includes: designing real-time serving on EKS (FastAPI + gRPC) achieving p50 ~18 ms, p95 ~60 ms at 300–500 QPS with a 99.95% SLO and instant rollback via versioned endpoints; delivering batch scoring over 116M+ records/year with Glue (PySpark) and SageMaker Processing (~5–7M records/hour) plus Kafka pipelines for near-real-time updates; and optimizing inference via distillation and ONNX/TensorRT quantization to cut model memory ~65% and p95 latency ~35%, contributing to a +22% audit hit rate, 30% faster triage, and ~30% lower compute cost. I’ve also shipped zero-to-one LLM/RAG features and explored document OCR/CV and edge-ready packaging patterns where appropriate.

I’m excited to help build resilient, scalable ML systems for Samsara—especially where real-time inference, MLOps rigor, and inference optimization meet. I’d welcome the chance to discuss how my experience can contribute to your team’s roadmap. Thank you for your time and consideration.
